SEARCH
Package Signal

Interface Event<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the value that is passed to the listener
All Known Implementing Classes:
Signal.SignalEvent
public interface Event<T>
The Event interface is a helper class for signal. It provides methods for connecting to the signal, once, and await. It also provides a method for retrieving the value of the signal.
Author:
haotian

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    T
    await()
    Waits for the signal to be fired and returns the value.
    Connection
    connect(Consumer<T> callBack)
    Connects a consumer to the signal and returns a SignalConnection object.
    Connection
    connect(Consumer<T> callBack, ConnectionContainer container)
    Connects a consumer to the signal and stores the connection in the container.
    Connection
    once(Consumer<T> callBack)
    Fires the call back once and disconnects.
    Connection
    once(Consumer<T> callBack, ConnectionContainer container)
    Fires the call back once and disconnects, and stores the connection in the container.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      Connection connect(Consumer<T> callBack)
      Connects a consumer to the signal and returns a SignalConnection object.
      Parameters:
      callBack - the consumer to be connected to the signal
      Returns:
      a SignalConnection object representing the connection

    • connect

      Connection connect(Consumer<T> callBack, ConnectionContainer container)
      Connects a consumer to the signal and stores the connection in the container.
      Parameters:
      callBack - the consumer to be connected to the signal
      container - the container to store the connection in
      Returns:
      a SignalConnection object representing the connection

    • once

      Connection once(Consumer<T> callBack, ConnectionContainer container)
      Fires the call back once and disconnects, and stores the connection in the container.
      Parameters:
      callBack - the consumer to be connected to the signal
      container - the container to store the connection in
      Returns:
      a SignalConnection object representing the connection

    • await

      T await()
      Waits for the signal to be fired and returns the value. If the signal is not fired, it waits until the signal is fired. If the waiting is interrupted, it prints a message and returns null.
      Returns:
      the value of the signal, or null if waiting is interrupted

    • once

      Connection once(Consumer<T> callBack)
      Fires the call back once and disconnects.
      Parameters:
      callBack - the consumer to be connected to the signal
      Returns:
      a SignalConnection object representing the connection
